courseSectionInformation: Prerequisite: FSHN 101 and FSHN 232, or consent of instructor; MCB 100 and MCB 101 recommended. Course should be taken concurrently with or prior to FSHN 340.
description: Examines the dangers, costs and prevention of foodborne illness as well as the training and motivation of food service employees in sanitary food handling and quality assurance practices. Upon completion of this course, student will be eligible to apply for the food service sanitation certificate issued by the State of Illinois. Prerequisite: FSHN 101 and FSHN 232, or consent of instructor; MCB 100 and MCB 101 recommended. Course should be taken concurrently with or prior to FSHN 340.
label: Food Service Sanitation
sectionRegistrationNotes: Restricted to BS:F Sci&Hm Nutr-Diettcs -UIUC or BS:FSci&Hm Nutr-Hosp Mgt -UIUC.
